I read, with sadness, the obituary of David Merrick (front page, April 27). David was really a unique force in the American theater.

I remember him more than 50 years ago when he was making his transition from Herman Shumlin's office to being an independent producer. He wanted me to play a part in one of his first productions. The financing fell through, so I accepted an offer to go to Hollywood to make my first picture, ''The Strange Love of Martha Ivers.''

I will never forget the day I left New York. David walked with me to the train station. We didn't take a cab. He gave me some good advice and helped me at a time when I was filled with trepidation. With all his idiosyncrasies, David Merrick was a wonderful man.
KIRK DOUGLAS Beverly Hills, Calif., April 27, 2000
